/access/bot-1.yml.title: Bot
/access/bot-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining bot access in app-interface.
This includes details about the bot's usernames, service accounts,
and associated roles.

name.description: The name of the bot.

description.description: A brief description of the bot.

org_username.description: The GitLab username associated with the bot.

github_username.description: The GitHub username associated with the bot.

openshift_serviceaccount.description:
The OpenShift service account associated with the bot,
in the format `<namespace>/<serviceaccount>`.

quay_username.description: The Quay username associated with the bot.

owner.description: Reference to the owner of the bot.

roles.description: A list of roles assigned to the bot.

name.description: The name of the LDAP/Rover group

notes.description: Notes added to the LDAP/Rover group

membersAreOwners.description: Grant "owner" permission to all members of the LDAP/Rover group

/acs/acs-policy-1.yml.title: Policy
/acs/acs-policy-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining security policies in Red Hat Advanced Cluster Security (ACS).
Policies are used to enforce security standards and best practices in Kubernetes
clusters. This schema includes details about policy severity, categories, scope,
integrations, and conditions.

description.description: A brief description of the policy, explaining its purpose and functionality.

name.description: The name of the policy. This should be unique and descriptive.

integrations.description:
Configuration for integrations associated with the policy, such as
notifiers for external systems.

notifiers.description: Configuration for notifier integrations associated with the policy.

jira.description: Configuration for integrating the policy with Jira for issue tracking.

escalationPolicy.description: Reference to the escalation policy used for Jira integration.

severity.description:
The severity level of the policy. This indicates the importance of the
policy and the potential impact of violations.

categories.description:
A list of categories that the policy belongs to. Categories help organize
policies based on their purpose or focus area.

scope.description:
The scope of the policy, defining the level (cluster or namespace) and
the specific clusters or namespaces it applies to.

level.description:
The level at which the policy is applied. This can be either `cluster`
or `namespace`.

clusters.description: A list of clusters that the policy applies to when the level is `cluster`.

namespaces.description: A list of namespaces that the policy applies to when the level is `namespace`.

conditions.description:
A list of conditions that define the criteria for policy violations.
Each condition specifies a rule that must be met for the policy to trigger.

/acs/acs-policy-condition-1.yml.title: Policy Condition
/acs/acs-policy-condition-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining conditions in Red Hat Advanced Cluster Security (ACS) policies.
Conditions specify the criteria that must be met for a policy to trigger.
This schema includes details about fields, comparisons, and thresholds
used to evaluate policy violations.

policyField.description:
The field in the policy that is being evaluated. Examples include
`cvss`, `severity`, `cve`, `image_tag`, and `image_age`.

comparison.description:
The comparison operator used to evaluate the policy condition.
Supported operators include `gt` (greater than), `gte` (greater than or equal to),
`eq` (equal to), `lt` (less than), and `lte` (less than or equal to).

score.description: The numerical score used for comparison when the `policyField` is `cvss`.

level.description:
The severity level used for comparison when the `policyField` is `severity`.
Supported levels include `low`, `moderate`, `important`, and `critical`.

fixable.description:
Indicates whether the condition applies only to fixable issues.
This is used when the `policyField` is `cve`.

tags.description: A list of image tags used for evaluation when the `policyField` is `image_tag`.

negate.description:
Indicates whether the condition should negate the specified tags.
This is used when the `policyField` is `image_tag`.

days.description: The number of days used for evaluation when the `policyField` is `image_age`.

policyField.description: Specifies that the condition applies to the CVSS score of vulnerabilities.

comparison.description: The comparison operator used to evaluate the CVSS score.

score.description: The CVSS score threshold for the condition.

policyField.description: Specifies that the condition applies to the severity level of vulnerabilities.

comparison.description: The comparison operator used to evaluate the severity level.

level.description: The severity level threshold for the condition.

policyField.description: Specifies that the condition applies to whether vulnerabilities are fixable.

fixable.description: Indicates whether the condition applies only to fixable vulnerabilities.

policyField.description: Specifies that the condition applies to image tags.

tags.description: A list of image tags used for evaluation.

negate.description: Indicates whether the condition negates the specified tags.

policyField.description: Specifies that the condition applies to the age of container images.

days.description: The number of days used to evaluate the age of container images.

/app-interface/app-interface-email-1.yml.title: app-interface-email
/app-interface/app-interface-email-1.yml.description:
Specification for a single automated email message.
Recipients can be static or dynamic based on service, cluster, namespace, aws account, role, or user relations.

name.description: Internal name for an email instantiation.

aliases.description: Recipient group aliases. Group names and membership logic defined in qontract-reconcile email-sender integration.

services.description: Dynamic recipient group depending on service <> role <> user relations.

clusters.description: Dynamic recipient group depending on cluster <> role <> user relations.

namespaces.description: Dynamic recipient group depending on namespace <> role <> user relations.

aws_accounts.description: Dynamic recipient group depending on aws account <> role <> user relations.

roles.description: Dynamic recipient group depending on role <> user relations.

users.description: Explicit list of recipients by user schema references.

/app-interface/app-interface-settings-1..title: App Interface Settings
/app-interface/app-interface-settings-1..description:
Specifications for configuring an app-interface instance.
Configuration includes repository configuration, credentials, integrations, and other operational parameters.

name.description: The name of the app-interface settings object.

description.description: A brief description of the app-interface settings object.

repoUrl.description: URL of the app-interface Git repository.

vault.description:
If true, a Vault instance provides secrets for automation.
If false, a config file provides secrets for automation.

kubeBinary.description: The Kubernetes CLI binary to use (e.g., kubectl or oc).

mergeRequestGateway.description: Determines the interface and destination for merge requests created with automation.

saasDeployJobTemplate.description: Used with visual-qontract to generate pipeline names.

hashLength.description: The length of the hash used in openshift-saas-deploy pipeline

mailAddress.description: The email address used for sending emails.

credentials.description: Vault secret containing credentials for the machine user (app-sre-bot) that interacts with the GitHub API.

ldap.description: LDAP configuration for authentication and directory services.

dependencies.description: List of dependencies required by the app-interface instance.

type.description: The type of dependency (e.g., OpenShift, AWS, GitHub).

services.description: List of service references associated with the dependency.

credentials.description: List of GraphQL client credential instantiations.

name.description: The name of the credential.

imageRepository.description: The repository for the SQL query image.

jobImage.description: The image for the SQL query job.

pullSecret.description: Vault secret for pulling the SQL query image.

pushGatewayCluster.description: Reference to the cluster used for the push gateway.

alertingServices.description: List of services authorized to send alerts.

endpointMonitoringBlackboxExporterModule.description: List of supported blackbox exporter modules for endpoint monitoring.

jiraWatcher.description: Configuration for the Jira watcher integration.

cloudflareEmailDomainAllowList.description: List of email domains allowed for Cloudflare access.

cloudflareDNSZoneMaxRecords.description: Maximum number of DNS records allowed per zone in Cloudflare.

provider.description: The provider for state storage (e.g., S3).

bucket.description: The bucket name for state storage.

credentials.description: Vault secret containing credentials for state storage.
Vault secret containing credentials for LDAP groups.

deadMansSnitchSettings.description: Configuration for Dead Man's Snitch integration.

alertMailAddresses.description: Email addresses used for Dead Man's Snitch alerts.

notesLink.description: Link to the SOP for handling Dead Man's Snitch alerts.

snitchesPath.description: Vault location for snitch URL secrets.

tokenCreds.description: Vault secret containing credentials for Dead Man's Snitch API.

alertType.description: Type of alert configured for the snitch.

credentials.description: Vault secret containing credentials for cost reporting.

defaultIssueType.description: Default issue type for Jira alerts.

defaultReopenState.description: Default reopen state for Jira alerts.

rhcsProvider.description: Configuration for RHCSv2 certificate generation and storing

vaultBasePath.description: Path in KV Vault mount where certificate secrets will be stored

caCertUrl.description: URL to obtain ceritifcate authority trust cert from

id.description: Unique ID of the custom message.

terraformResourcesProviderExclusions.description: Exclusions for Terraform resources by provider.

terraformResourcesProviderExclusionsByPr.description: Deprecated object for Terraform resource exclusions by provisioner.

/app-interface/app-interface-slack-notif.title: App Interface Slack Notification
/app-interface/app-interface-slack-notif.description:
Schema for defining a single Slack notification message.
Notifications can be sent to specific channels or users.

name.description: The name of the Slack notification object.

subject.description: The subject or title of the Slack notification message.

channel.description: The Slack channel where the notification will be sent.

users.description: List of Slack users who will receive the notification.

body.description: The body content of the Slack notification message.

/app-interface/app-interface-sql-query-1.title: App Interface SQL Query
/app-interface/app-interface-sql-query-1.description:
Schema for defining SQL queries for automated execution.
Includes details about the query, its schedule, output, and overrides.

name.description: The name of the SQL query object, following Kubernetes container naming conventions.

namespace.description: Reference to the namespace where the SQL query will be executed.

identifier.description: The identifier for the RDS instance as defined in a namespace instantiation.

requestor.description: Reference to the user who requested the SQL query.

db_port.description: The port number for the database connection.

db_name.description: The name of the database to connect to.

db_user.description: The username for the database connection.

output.description:
The output method for the SQL query results. Options include:
- `stdout`: Print results to standard output.
- `filesystem`: Save results to the filesystem.
- `encrypted`: Save results in an encrypted format.

schedule.description: The schedule for executing the SQL query, defined in cron format.

delete.description: Indicates whether the SQL query should be deleted after execution.

query.description: The SQL query to be executed.

queries.description: A list of SQL queries to be executed.

/app-interface/change-type-1.yml.title: App Interface Change Type
/app-interface/change-type-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining change types in app-interface.
Change types influence how merge requests are processed and provide
context for changes, including priority, restrictions, and inheritance.

name.description: The name of the change type.

description.description: A brief description of the change type.

priority.description:
The priority of the change type, which influences the order
in which merge requests are processed.

contextType.description: The type of context associated with the change type.

contextSchema.description: The schema defining the context for the change type.

disabled.description:
Indicates whether the change type is disabled.
A disabled change type does not have any effect but will still
log into the pull request check logs.

restrictive.description:
Indicates whether the change type is restrictive.
Entities protected with a restrictive change type can only be
changed by the team assigned to the change type.

inherit.description:
A list of additional change types whose changes are inherited
by this change type.

changes.description:
A list of changes associated with the change type. Each change
specifies a provider, schema, and additional context.

provider.description:
The provider for the change. Supported providers include
`jsonPath` and `change-type`.

changeSchema.description: The schema defining the structure of the change.

jsonPathSelectors.description: A list of JSONPath selectors used to identify the changes.

changeTypes.description: A list of additional change types associated with this change.

context.description: Context for the change, including selectors and conditions.

selector.description: The selector used to identify the context for the change.

where.description:
Specifies where the context applies. Supported values
include `backrefs`.

when.description:
Specifies when the context applies. Supported values
include `added` and `removed`.

implicitOwnership.description:
A list of implicit ownership rules for the change type.
These rules define ownership based on JSONPath selectors.

provider.description:
The provider for the implicit ownership rule.
Supported provider is `jsonPath`.

jsonPathSelector.description: The JSONPath selector used to define the ownership rule.

/app-interface/credentials-request-1.yml.title: App Interface Credentials Request
/app-interface/credentials-request-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining a credentials request in app-interface.
This includes details about the user requesting the credentials
and the credentials being requested.

name.description: The name of the credentials request object.

description.description: A brief description of the credentials request.

user.description: Reference to the user who is requesting the credentials.

/app-interface/database-access-1.yml.title: App Interface Database Access
/app-interface/database-access-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining database access in app-interface.
This includes details about the user, database, and access permissions.

name.description: The name of the database access object.

username.description: The username for the database access.

database.description: The name of the database to which access is being granted.

delete.description: Indicates whether the database access should be deleted.

access.description: A list of access permissions for the database.

grants.description: A list of grants specifying the permissions for the database.

target.description: The target schema within the database for the access permissions.

dbschema.description: The schema within the database to which the access applies.

/app-interface/deletion-approval-1.yml.title: App Interface Deletion Approval
/app-interface/deletion-approval-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining deletion approvals in app-interface.
This includes details about the resource being deleted,
the type of resource, and the expiration of the approval.

expiration.description:
The expiration date for the deletion approval.
After this date, the approval is no longer valid.

type.description: The type of resource for which deletion is being approved.

name.description: The name of the resource for which deletion is being approved.

/app-interface/graphql-schemas-1.yml.title: App Interface GraphQL Schemas
/app-interface/graphql-schemas-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining GraphQL configurations in app-interface.
This includes details about GraphQL fields, interfaces, and
strategies for resolving data.

conf.description:
A configuration for a GraphQL schema, including fields,
data files, and interface resolution strategies.

name.description: The name of the GraphQL configuration.

fields.description: A list of fields defined in the GraphQL configuration.

datafile.description:
The data file schema associated with the GraphQL configuration.
This is used in bundle and validation for one-to-one mapping between
GraphQL configuration (type) and datafile schema.
If GraphQL type is an interface and all subtypes share the same schema,
only set this for interface type, not needed for subtypes.
This is needed for standalone datafile used as crossref `$ref: path_to_data_file`.
Note this field requires `schema` and `path` in `fields`.

isInterface.description: Indicates whether this configuration is an interface.

interface.description: The name of the interface implemented by this configuration.

interfaceResolve.description: The strategy for resolving interfaces in the GraphQL configuration.

strategy.description:
The strategy used for interface resolution.
Supported strategies include `fieldMap` and `schema`.

field.description: The field used for interface resolution with fieldMap strategy.

fieldMap.description:
A mapping of fields for interface resolution.
Key is the field value from datafile, value is GraphQL type.

field.description:
A field definition in a GraphQL configuration, including
its type, uniqueness, and other attributes.

name.description: The name of the field.

isInterface.description: Indicates whether the field is part of an interface.

isUnique.description:
Indicates whether the field is global unique.
When multiple fields marked as unique, each field is checked individually,
no duplicate values are allowed for each field.
This is like unique constraint per field in database.

isContextUnique.description:
Indicates whether the field is unique within an object array.
When multiple fields marked as context unique, all fields are grouped together to determine uniqueness,
partial fields duplicate are allowed.
This is like unique constraint for multiple fields combo in database.

isRequired.description: Indicates whether the field is required.

isSearchable.description: Indicates whether the field is searchable.

isList.description: Indicates whether the field is a list.

isResource.description: Indicates whether the field represents a resource.

resolveResource.description: Indicates whether the field resolves a resource.

synthetic.description: Synthetic field details, including schema and sub-attributes.

schema.description: The schema associated with the synthetic field.

subAttr.description: The sub-attribute of the synthetic field.

datafileSchema.description:
The schema of the data file associated with the field.
Only used in `Query` fields.

/app-interface/prometheus-rule-test-1.ym.title: App Interface Prometheus Rule Test
/app-interface/prometheus-rule-test-1.ym.description:
Schema for defining Prometheus rule tests in app-interface.
This includes configurations for rule files, evaluation intervals,
test cases, and expected outputs.

rule_files.description: A list of Prometheus rule files to be tested.

evaluation_interval.description: The interval at which Prometheus evaluates the rules.

group_eval_order.description: The order in which rule groups are evaluated.

tests.description: A list of test cases for Prometheus rules.

interval.description: The interval at which the test is executed.

input_series.description: A list of input time series for the test.

series.description: The name of the input time series.

values.description: The values for the input time series.

alert_rule_test.description: A list of alert rule tests to validate alerting behavior.

eval_time.description: The evaluation time for the alert rule test.

alertname.description: The name of the alert being tested.

exp_alerts.description: The expected alerts generated by the test.

exp_labels.description: The expected labels for the alert.

exp_annotations.description: The expected annotations for the alert.

promql_expr_test.description: A list of PromQL expression tests to validate query behavior.

eval_time.description: The evaluation time for the PromQL expression test.

exp_samples.description: The expected samples generated by the PromQL expression.

labels.description: The labels for the expected sample.

value.description: The value of the expected sample.

external_labels.description: External labels applied to the test environment.

/app-interface/query-validation-1.yml.title: App Interface Query Validation
/app-interface/query-validation-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining query validation configurations in app-interface.
This includes details about the queries to validate, escalation policies,
and associated resources.

name.description: A unique name for the query validation configuration.

description.description: A description of the queries included in the file.

escalationPolicy.description: Reference to the escalation policy to be used if validation fails.

queries.description: A list of queries to validate.

path.description: The path to the resource query to be tested.

resources.description: A list of resources associated with the query validation.

/app-interface/resource-template-test-1..title: App Interface Resource Template Test
/app-interface/resource-template-test-1..description:
Schema for defining resource template tests in app-interface.
This includes details about the resource template to be tested,
the expected result, and other metadata.

name.description: A unique name for the resource template test.

description.description: A description of the resource template test.

resourcePath.description: The path to the resource template to be tested.

expectedResult.description: The expected result of the templating process to compare against.

/app-interface/template-1.yml.title: App Interface Template
/app-interface/template-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining templates in app-interface.
This includes details about the template, its target path,
conditions, tests, and rendering options.

name.description: A unique name for the template.

autoApproved.description: Indicates whether the template is automatically approved.

targetPath.description: The target path where the template will be applied.

condition.description: A condition that must be met for the template to be applied.

overwrite.description: whether to overwrite if file in target path or identifier in patch already exist.

patch.description: A patch to be applied to the template.

path.description: JSON path to the target field in the template to patch.

identifier.description:
Unique identifier field to use with path results.
Can be a string (field name) or a JSON path.
Examples:
  path_results = [{'id': 1, 'name': 'a'}, {'id': 2, 'name': 'b'}]
  identifier = 'id'
  path_results = ['a', 'b']
  identifier = '$.id'

template.description: The content of the template to be rendered.

templateTest.description: A list of tests to validate the template.

trimBlocks.description: Indicates whether to trim blocks during rendering.

lstripBlocks.description: Indicates whether to strip leading whitespace from blocks.

keepTrailingNewline.description: Indicates whether to keep trailing newlines in the rendered template.

/app-interface/template-collection-1.yml.title: App Interface Template Collection
/app-interface/template-collection-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining a collection of templates in app-interface.
This includes details about the templates, variables, and
configurations for generating multiple templates.

name.description: A unique name for the template collection.

additionalMrLabels.description: Additional merge request labels to be applied to the templates.

description.description: A description of the template collection.

enableAutoApproval.description: Indicates whether auto-approval is enabled for the template collection.

forEach.description: Configuration for iterating over a list of items to generate templates.

items.description: A list of objects on which to run this template collection.

variables.description: Variables to be used in the templates.

static.description: Static variables to be used in the templates.

dynamic.description: Dynamic variables fetched from GraphQL queries.

name.description: The name of the dynamic variable.

query.description: The GraphQL query used to fetch the dynamic variable.

templates.description: A list of templates to be included in the collection.

/app-interface/template-test-1.yml.title: App Interface Template Test
/app-interface/template-test-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining tests for templates in app-interface.
This includes details about the variables, expected outputs,
and conditions for validating template rendering.

name.description: A unique name for the template test.

variables.description: Variables to be used in the template test.

current.description: The current content of the file to be templated.

expectedTargetPath.description: The expected result of the target path after rendering the template.

expectedOutput.description: The expected output of the template after rendering.

grafanaUrls.description:
List of links to Grafana Dashboard/Folders associated with the service. Please provide
a title together with the link.

sopsUrl.description:
Link to the git repo path that contains the top-level for the service
SOPs.

architectureDocument.description:
The Architecture Document should be written with SREs as the target audience. Anyone
reading the Architecture Document should understand how the service works, even
without any prior background. This document will be the primary reference during
incidents. To ensure the Architecture Document is always accessible to SREs and its
changes properly reviewed and tracked, it must be written in markdown and stored in
a place where SREs can control its changes.

serviceOwners.description: Teams or individuals who is/are responsible for the running instance of the software.

serviceNotifications.description: Teams or individuals who is/are should get notifications related to the service.

provider.description: Reference to a monitoring provider to use for this endpoint

showInReviewQueue.description: Include MRs from this repo in the AppSRE Review Queue

items.description: List of tests must pass before merging.

imageBuildUrl.description: URL for the component's image build job (jenkins job, rhtap pipeline page, etc.)

managePermissions.description: should permissions be managed on the repository

items.description: commit sha of this repository that should not be promoted
commit sha of this repository that should be promoted even without being published with success to any subscribed channels

appCode.description: The CMDB Application ID of the application or workload.

costCenter.description: The 3-digit code identifying the Cost Center funding the application resources.

/app-sre/app-changelog-1.yml.title: Application Changelog
/app-sre/app-changelog-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining changelogs for applications defined in app-interface.
This includes details about the application, the dates of changes,
and descriptions of the changes made.

app.description: Reference to the application associated with the changelog.

changelog.description:
A list of changelog entries for the application. Each entry includes
the date of the change and a list of changes made.

date.description: The date when the changes were made, in ISO 8601 format.

changes.description:
A list of changes made on the specified date. Each change includes
tags and a description.

tags.description:
A list of tags categorizing the change (e.g., `bugfix`,
`feature`, `improvement`).

description.description: A detailed description of the change made.

/app-sre/automated-action-1.yml.title: Automated Action
/app-sre/automated-action-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining automated actions. Automated actions
represent predefined operations that can be executed programmatically,
with configurable retries, operation limits, and descriptions.

type.description:
The automated action type, which indicates the kind of operation
being performed.

description.description:
A brief description of the automated action, explaining its purpose
and functionality.

instances.description: A list of instances where the automated action can be executed.

maxOps.description:
The maximum number of operations that can be performed per hour. This
is used to limit the frequency of the automated action to prevent
overloading systems or exceeding quotas.

arguments.description: Action arguments that can be used to customize the behavior of the action.

action_user.description: The user filter for the action list.

max_age_minutes.description: The maximum age of actions to include in the list, in minutes.

identifier.description: The external resource identifier regex pattern to match.

api_version.description: The api version regex pattern to match.

kind.description: The kind regex pattern to match.

name.description: The name regex pattern to match.

action_user.description: The user filter for the action list.

max_age_minutes.description: The maximum age of actions to include in the list, in minutes.

namespace.description: The namespace where the Elasticache instance is located.

identifier.description: The Elasticache identifier regex pattern to match.

namespace.description: The namespace where the RDS instance is located.

identifier.description: The RDS identifier regex pattern to match.

namespace.description: The namespace where the RDS instance is located.

identifier.description: The RDS identifier regex pattern to match.

api_version.description: The api version regex pattern to match.

kind.description: The kind regex pattern to match.

name.description: The name regex pattern to match.

kind.description: The kind regex pattern to match.

name.description: The name regex pattern to match.

/app-sre/automated-actions-instance-1.ym.title: Automated Actions Instance
/app-sre/automated-actions-instance-1.ym.description:
Schema for defining instances of automated actions.
Each instance represents a deployment of automated actions with
associated metadata, such as name, description, and deployment details.

name.description:
The unique name of the automated actions instance. This name is used
to identify the instance across the system.

description.description:
A brief description of the automated actions instance, explaining its
purpose and functionality.

deployment.description:
Reference to the OpenShift namespace where the automated actions
instance is deployed. This will be replaced by proper URL and token
references in the future.

/app-sre/contract-1.yml.title: Contract
/app-sre/contract-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining contracts.
Contracts are agreements between the platform operator and platform tenants.

name.description:
The name of the contract. This should be a unique identifier that
clearly represents the purpose or scope of the contract.

description.description:
A detailed description of the contract, explaining its purpose,
scope, and any relevant details.

source.description:
The location of the contract. This should be a valid URI pointing
to the source of the contract, such as a document or repository.

/app-sre/contract-version-1.yml.title: Contract Version
/app-sre/contract-version-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining a contract-1.yml schema version.
Each version represents a specific iteration of a contract, including its name,
description, associated contract, and source location.

name.description:
The name of the contract version. This should uniquely identify the
version and indicate its purpose or scope.

description.description:
A detailed description of the contract version, explaining its purpose,
scope, and any relevant details.

contract.description:
Reference to the contract that this version is associated with. This
links the version to its parent contract.

source.description:
The location of the contract version. This should be a valid URI pointing
to the source of the version, such as a document or repository.

/app-sre/environment-1.yml.title: Environment
/app-sre/environment-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining environments in an app-interface instance.
Environments represent logical groupings of resources and configurations for applications,
including their name, description, product association, parameters, and dependencies.

name.description: The unique name of the environment.

description.description:
A detailed description of the environment, explaining its purpose
and scope.

product.description: Reference to the product associated with the environment.

parameters.description:
A set of key-value pairs representing environment-level parameters.
These parameters are used to configure the environment.

secretParameters.description: A list of environment-level parameters sourced from vault secrets.

dependsOn.description:
Reference to another environment that this environment depends on.
This is used to define dependencies between environments.

servicePhase.description: The phase of the service lifecycle that this environment represents.

/app-sre/escalation-policy-1.yml.title: Escalation Policy
/app-sre/escalation-policy-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining escalation policies for services. Escalation policies
specify how incidents or issues are escalated, including the channels
and configurations for notifications, such as Slack, email, PagerDuty,
and Jira.

name.description: The unique name of the escalation policy.

description.description:
A description of the escalation policy, explaining its purpose
and scope.

channels.description:
The notification channels configured for the escalation policy. These
channels specify how and where notifications are sent during an escalation.

slackUserGroup.description:
A list of Slack user groups to notify during an escalation. Each
user group is referenced by its permissions configuration.

email.description: A list of email addresses to notify during an escalation.

pagerduty.description: Reference to the PagerDuty target to notify during an escalation.

jiraBoard.description: A list of Jira boards to use for tracking escalations.

jiraComponents.description: components to set on jira tickets created when following the escalation policy

jiraLabels.description: A list of labels to add to Jira tickets created during an escalation.

nextEscalationPolicy.description:
Reference to the next escalation policy to follow if the current
policy does not resolve the issue.

/app-sre/gabi-instance-1.yml.title: GABI Instance
/app-sre/gabi-instance-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining a GABI (go-auditable-db-interface) instance.
A GABI instance allows tenants to send SQL commands to their production
databases for troubleshooting, with auditing via Splunk. This schema
supports requesting a waiver for the read replica requirement,
and tracks signoff managers, users, and deployment instances.

name.description:
The unique name of the GABI instance. Used to identify the instance
across the system.

description.description:
A detailed description of the GABI instance, including its purpose
and any relevant context.

readReplicasWaiverPledge.description:
Text pledge provided by the tenant when requesting a waiver for the
read replica requirement. This should outline the risks accepted by
the tenant if the waiver is granted.

signoffManagers.description:
A list of users who have managerial authority to approve the waiver
for the read replica requirement. Each entry references a user.

users.description:
A list of users authorized to access this GABI instance. Each entry
references a user.

instances.description:
A list of deployment instances for this GABI configuration. Each
instance specifies the AWS account, identifier, and namespace.

account.description: Reference to the AWS account associated with this GABI instance deployment.

identifier.description: A unique identifier for this deployment instance.

namespace.description: Reference to the OpenShift namespace where this GABI instance is deployed.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date for GABI instance approval in YYYY-MM-DD format.

imageRef.description: Image ref used by the shard.

subSharding.description: Sub-sharding strategy used by a shard.

disableUnleash.description: disable integration interaction with unleash instance

environmentAware.description: integration is aware of the environment it is running in

extraArgs.description: additional arguments to pass to integration

items.description: additional environment variables to set for the integration

secretName.description: secret name to get environment variable from

secretKey.description: secret key to get value from and to use as the environment variable name

name.description: environment variable name

internalCertificates.description: integration requires internal certificates to execute

logs.description: ship logs to providers (cloudwatch is enabled by default)

sleepDurationSecs.description: time to sleep in seconds between integration executions

storageClassName.description: kubernetes storage class name for the cache

concurrencyPolicy.description: how to treat concurrent executions of the integration

successfulJobHistoryLimit.description: number of history records reserved for successful integration executions

failedJobHistoryLimit.description: number of history records reserved for failed integration executions

enablePushgateway.description: push metrics at the end of the run to the configured Pushgateway

/app-sre/maintenance-1.yml.title: Maintenance
/app-sre/maintenance-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining service maintenances. Maintenances represent planned
or ongoing service interruptions or changes, including their name, message,
affected services, scheduled time window, and announcement configuration.
This schema enables tenants to self-service maintenance announcements on
status pages and to communicate maintenance details to AppSRE and stakeholders.

name.description:
The unique name of the maintenance. Used to identify and reference
the maintenance event across the system.

message.description:
A message describing the maintenance, its purpose, or its expected
impact on services.

affectedServices.description:
A list of services affected by this maintenance. Each entry references
an application that will be impacted during the maintenance window.

scheduledStart.description:
The scheduled start time for the maintenance window, in ISO 8601
date-time format.

scheduledEnd.description:
The scheduled end time for the maintenance window, in ISO 8601
date-time format.

announcements.description:
A list of announcement configurations for this maintenance. Each
announcement specifies a provider (such as statuspage), the page to
announce on, and notification options for subscribers.

provider.description: The provider used for the maintenance announcement.

page.description:
Reference to the status page where the maintenance will be
announced.

remindSubscribers.description:
If true, subscribers will be reminded before the maintenance
starts.

notifySubscribersOnStart.description:
If true, subscribers will be notified when the maintenance
begins.

notifySubscribersOnCompletion.description:
If true, subscribers will be notified when the maintenance
is completed.

/app-sre/network-1.yml.title: Network
/app-sre/network-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining a network reservation. Networks represent CIDR blocks
that can be reserved for use by VPCs or other resources. This schema enables
tracking of network allocations, parent-child relationships between networks,
and the entity currently using the network. It supports automation and
visibility for network management in cloud environments.

name.description:
The unique name of the network. Used to identify the network reservation
across the system.

description.description:
A detailed description of the network, its intended use, or any
relevant context for the reservation.

inUseBy.description:
Reference to the entity that has claimed this network. If the network
is unclaimed, this value will be null. Used to track which resource
or team is currently using the network.

vpc.description: Reference to the VPC that is currently using this network.

networkAddress.description:
The network address in CIDR format (e.g., 10.0.200.0/24). This defines
the range of IP addresses covered by this network reservation.

parentNetwork.description:
Reference to the parent network, if this network is a subdivision of
a larger block. If this is a root network, this property will be null.

region.description: The cloud provider region where this network resides.

/app-sre/pgp-reencrypt-settings-1.yml.title: PGP Re-encrypt Settings
/app-sre/pgp-reencrypt-settings-1.yml.description:
Schema for configuring PGP re-encryption settings. This schema defines
the keys and vault paths used for re-encrypting sensitive data, such as
AWS account passwords, with a central APP-SRE PGP key. It also allows
specifying AWS accounts to skip re-encryption and use an alternative
notification method. These settings help manage secure key rotation and
ensure users are notified of expiring or invalid keys.

public_gpg_key.description:
The PGP public key owned by APP-SRE, used to encrypt user data
instead of individual user keys. This enables centralized encryption
management and simplifies key rotation.

private_pgp_key_vault_path.description:
The vault path to the private PGP key used for decrypting and
re-encrypting data. This key must be kept secure and accessible
only to authorized integrations.

reencrypt_vault_path.description:
The base vault path where PGP-encrypted entries are read from and
written to during the re-encryption process.

aws_account_output_vault_path.description:
The vault path where re-encrypted AWS account passwords are written.
This ensures that updated credentials are securely stored.

skip_aws_accounts.description:
A list of AWS accounts to skip during the re-encryption process.
Access requests for these accounts will use the SMTP mail send
implementation in the terraform-users integration instead of PGP
re-encryption.

/app-sre/pipelines-provider-1.yml.title: Pipelines Provider
/app-sre/pipelines-provider-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining a pipelines provider. Pipelines providers declare
configuration for an automated deployment pipeline service used for specific tenant
services and can be used to define different types of providers depending on the
specific technology used.

name.description:
The unique name of the pipelines provider. Used to identify the provider
across the system.

description.description:
A detailed description of the pipelines provider, including its purpose
and any relevant context.

provider.description: The type of pipelines provider. Currently, only 'tekton' is supported.

defaults.description:
Reference to the default configuration for this pipelines provider.
This declares the default settings for the pipeline execution,
which can be overridden in the current pipelines provider.

namespace.description:
Reference to the OpenShift namespace where the pipelines provider
resources will be deployed.

retention.description:
Describes the retention policy for builds. Specifies how many builds
are kept, both by time (days) and by minimum/maximum count.

days.description:
Maximum retention expressed in days. Builds older than this will
be deleted, unless protected by minimum or maximum settings.

minimum.description:
Minimum number of builds that will always be kept, regardless of
the 'days' setting.

maximum.description:
Maximum number of builds that will be kept, even if within the
retention period.

taskTemplates.description:
A list of Tekton Task jinja2 templates that will be used to create
the corresponding objects in the provider namespace.

pipelineTemplates.description:
Tekton Pipeline templates that will be used to create the
corresponding objects in the provider namespace. This object defines
the pipeline templates that are supported by the provider.

deployResources.description:
CPU and memory resources used by the openshift-saas-deploy step of the
openshift-saas-deploy tasks created by the openshift-tekton-resources
integration.

taskTemplates.description:
Tekton Task jinja2 templates that will be used to create the corresponding
objects in the provider namespace.

pipelineTemplates.description:
Tekton Pipeline jinja2 templates that will be used to create the corresponding
objects in the provider namespace. This object defines the types of pipeline
templates that we support. Since they have to be referred from the integration
that triggers the pipeline via a PipelineRun this is actually an object rather
than a list. Properties of this object will be the different pipelines supported
in qontract-reconcile code.

deployResources.description:
CPU and memory resources used by the openshift-saas-deploy step of the
openshift-saas-deploy tasks created by the openshift-tekton-resources
integration.

productOwners.description: Teams or individuals who is/are responsible for the running instance of the software.

/app-sre/report-1.yml.title: Report
/app-sre/report-1.yml.description:
[DEPRECATED] Schema for defining a report. This schema is not actively
used. There are no current plans for use, but it may be referenced
for legacy data or future platform enhancements.

app.description:
Reference to the application this report is associated with. This
links the report to its parent app for context and traceability.

name.description:
The unique name of the report. Used to identify the report within
the context of the application.

date.description:
The date the report was generated or is relevant for, in ISO 8601
format (YYYY-MM-DD).

contentFormatVersion.description:
The version of the report content format, following semantic versioning
(e.g., 1.0.0). This helps consumers interpret the structure of the content.

content.description:
The main content of the report. This may be plain text, markdown, or
another format as defined by the content format version.

secretParameters.description: saas file level parameters from vault secrets

validateTargetsInApp.description: indicates a desire to validate that all targets belong to the same app as the saas file itself

validatePlannedData.description: enable skipping planned data validation, mostly for automated bootstrap pusrposes

secretParameters.description: resource template level parameters from vault secrets

deprecated.description: prevent updates to a saas file

timeout.description:
Maximum time the deployment job is allowed to last. In Tekton it defaults to
60 minutes. We don't allow smaller times as Tekton implementation currently deletes
PipelineRun pods, hence destroying logs.

deployResources.description: CPU and memory resources used by the openshift-saas-deploy step of the openshift-saas-deploy tasks created by the openshit-tekton-resources integration

/app-sre/saas-file-authentication-1.yml.description: saas file authentication section for image and/or code credentials

redeployOnPublisherConfigChange.description:
Whether to redeploy if a config change happened in a publisher. This will set
target_config_hash in promotion_data. This is mainly intended for test jobs.

soakDays.description: number of days to wait for promotion

schedule.description: Same as AUS schedule - crontab expression to optionally restrict deployment windows

secretParameters.description: target level parameters from vault secrets

images.description: wait for all images to exist before triggering a deployment

name.description: image repository name

slos.description: list of file path of slo documents to be evaluated before promoting changes

/app-sre/scorecard-2.yml.title: Scorecard
/app-sre/scorecard-2.yml.description:
Schema for defining a self-service scorecard for limited-scope service engagements.
The scorecard helps service owners assess their maturity and reliability
based on well-defined acceptance criteria established by AppSRE for
production services. Each scorecard is a self-assessment, to be filled
in and maintained by service owners, and is intended to be visible to
all stakeholders. The scorecard enables AppSRE to raise awareness and
provide recommendations for improving service maturity.

app.description:
Reference to the application this scorecard is associated with.
Links the scorecard to its parent app for context and traceability.

date.description: The date the scorecard was completed or updated, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

acceptanceCriteria.description:
A list of acceptance criteria items representing the maturity and
reliability checks for the service. Each item corresponds to a
well-defined criterion, its current status, and an optional comment.
All 37 criteria must be included for a complete assessment.

name.description:
The unique identifier for the acceptance criterion, such as
CONTINUITY-0001 or INCIDENT-MGMT-0001. Each criterion maps to
a specific requirement for production readiness.

status.description:
The current status of the acceptance criterion. Use 'green' for
fully met, 'yellow' for partially met or in progress, and 'red'
for not met.

comment.description:
Optional comment providing additional context, explanation, or
justification for the status of this criterion.

/app-sre/slo-document-1.yml.title: SLO Document
/app-sre/slo-document-1.yml.description:
Schema for documenting Service Level Objectives (SLOs) for an application or
component. This schema enables teams to transparently define, track, and
communicate SLOs, including SLI definitions, targets, time windows, and
justifications. SLO documents help drive reliability, set user expectations,
and support automated alerting and reporting.

name.description:
The unique name of the SLO document. Used to identify this document
across the system.

app.description: Reference to the application this SLO document applies to.

namespaces.description:
A list of namespaces where this SLO document applies. Each entry
specifies the target namespace, optional SLO namespace for alerting,
and Prometheus access configuration.

namespace.description: Reference to the OpenShift namespace where the SLO applies.

SLONamespace.description:
Namespace where PrometheusRule objects for SLO alerts will be created.
Used with the slo-to-status-board flow, which depends on the status-board service.
If omitted, defaults to the observability namespace of the cluster.

prometheusAccess.description:
Configuration for accessing Prometheus target specified in SLONamespace, including
URL and credentials.

url.description: The URL of the Prometheus instance.

username.description: Vault secret for the Prometheus username.

password.description: Vault secret for the Prometheus password.

slos.description:
A list of SLO definitions for this service or component. Each SLO
specifies the SLI type, specification, target, time window, and
supporting details such as Prometheus expressions and dashboards.

name.description: The name of the SLO, typically the service or metric being measured.

SLIType.description:
The type of Service Level Indicator (SLI) being measured, such as
latency, availability, or correctness.

SLISpecification.description:
A clear description of the SLI metric being measured, e.g.,
"The proportion of valid requests served successfully."

SLODetails.description:
A thorough description of this SLO, including:
  * SLI description: What is being measured
  * SLI rationale: Why it is measured
  * Implementation details: How it is measured
  * SLO rationale: Why the targets were chosen
  * Alerting: How alerting is implemented
Must be a URL to a GitHub or GitLab document.

SLOTargetUnit.description:
The unit for the SLO target and Prometheus expression:
  * Use 'percent_0_1' for values between 0 and 1
  * Use 'percent_0_100' for values between 0 and 100

SLOParameters.description:
Parameters for the SLO, such as the time window over which it is
measured (e.g., "28d" for 28 days).

window.description: The time window for measuring the SLO, in days (e.g., "28d").

expr.description:
The Prometheus expression used to calculate the SLO. Should be
expressed in the units of 'SLOTargetUnit'. This expression is
processed with Jinja using the SLOParameters as input.

SLOTarget.description:
The numeric goal for the SLO, expressed in the unit specified by
'SLOTargetUnit' (e.g., 99.9 for percent_0_100).

prometheusRules.description:
File reference to Prometheus rules associated with this SLO
definition.

prometheusRulesTests.description: The location of the Prometheus rules tests for the associated rules.

dashboard.description: The URL of the Grafana dashboard for visualizing this SLO.

SLIErrorQuery.description:
Prometheus expression for querying error portion of metric utilized for measuring SLO.
By defining this and SLITotalQuery, multi-window multi-burnrate prometheus rules will
be generated for the SLO.

SLITotalQuery.description:
Prometheus expression for querying total samples of metric utilized for measuring SLO.
By defining this and SLIErrorQuery, multi-window multi-burnrate prometheus rules will
be generated for the SLO.

/app-sre/sre-checkpoint-1.yml.title: SRE Checkpoint
/app-sre/sre-checkpoint-1.yml.description:
Schema for documenting an SRE checkpoint for a service. SRE checkpoints are
periodic reviews performed by AppSRE to assess service reliability, adherence
to best practices, and operational readiness. The process includes verifying
metadata, SLOs, SOPs, and reliability, and tracking improvements via JIRA.
This schema enables traceability of checkpoint events, responsible engineers,
and contract versions.

app.description:
Reference to the application that is the subject of this SRE checkpoint.
Links the checkpoint to its parent app for context and traceability.

sre.description: Reference to the AppSRE engineer responsible for conducting this checkpoint.

date.description: The date the SRE checkpoint was performed, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

issue.description: The JIRA issue key tracking this SRE checkpoint (e.g., APPSRE-12345).

contractVersion.description:
Reference to the contract version in effect at the time of the checkpoint.
This links the checkpoint to the set of requirements and expectations
evaluated during the review.

/app-sre/tekton-pipeline-template-1.yml.title: Tekton Pipeline Template
/app-sre/tekton-pipeline-template-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining a Tekton pipeline template. Tekton pipeline templates
are reusable definitions for CI/CD pipelines that can be deployed in
Tekton pipeline provider namespaces. This schema allows specifying the
template's name, type, file path, and variables for parameterization.
It supports both per-SaaS file and per-namespace pipeline templates,
with naming constraints to ensure compatibility with Tekton object limits.

name.description:
The unique name of the Tekton pipeline template. Naming constraints
apply based on the template type to ensure compatibility with Tekton
object name length limits.

type.description:
The type of pipeline template. Use 'onePerSaasFile' for templates
that are unique per SaaS file, or 'onePerNamespace' for templates
that are unique per namespace.

path.description: The file path to the pipeline template definition.

variables.description:
A mapping of variable names to values for parameterizing the pipeline
template. Variables can be used to customize pipeline behavior for
different deployments.

name.description:
One per namespace file Template name. It is limited in size as the tekton
object name is limited to 63 characters.

One per saas file Template name. It is very limited in size as the tekton
pipeline final name will also contain the saas file and the max size of
a pipeline is limited to 63 characters.

But we impose another restriction, because pipeline retries generate a
pipeline run that appends 7 characters to the pipeline name. Since pipeline
runs also have a 63 character limit, this limits pipeline names to 56
characters, which finally limits the pipeline names to 15. See all the
details in the openshift-tekton-resources integration.

/app-sre/tekton-provider-defaults-1.yml.title: Tekton Provider Defaults
/app-sre/tekton-provider-defaults-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining default configuration values for Tekton pipeline providers.
These defaults ensure that all required fields for a Tekton provider are present,
reducing duplication and simplifying provider definitions. Providers can override
any field as needed, but will always inherit a complete set of defaults for
retention, task and pipeline templates, and deployment resources.

name.description:
The unique name of the Tekton provider defaults configuration. Used to
identify and reference this set of defaults.

description.description:
A detailed description of the defaults configuration, including its
intended use and any relevant context.

retention.description:
The retention policy for builds managed by the provider. Specifies how
many builds are kept, both by time (days) and by minimum count.

days.description:
Maximum retention expressed in days. Builds older than this will
be deleted, unless protected by the minimum setting.

minimum.description:
Minimum number of builds that will always be kept, regardless of
the 'days' setting.

taskTemplates.description:
A list of Tekton Task jinja2 templates that will be used to create
the corresponding objects in the provider namespace.

pipelineTemplates.description:
Tekton Pipeline jinja2 templates that will be used to create the
corresponding objects in the provider namespace. This object defines
the types of pipeline templates that are supported. Properties of this
object will be the different pipelines supported in qontract-reconcile.

openshiftSaasDeploy.description: Reference to the pipeline template for OpenShift SaaS deploy tasks.

deployResources.description:
CPU and memory resources used by the openshift-saas-deploy step of the
openshift-saas-deploy tasks created by the openshift-tekton-resources
integration.

/app-sre/tekton-task-template-1.yml.title: Tekton Task Template
/app-sre/tekton-task-template-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining a Tekton task template. Tekton task templates are reusable
definitions for CI/CD tasks that can be deployed in Tekton pipeline provider
namespaces. This schema allows specifying the template's name, type, file path,
and variables for parameterization. It supports both per-SaaS file and per-namespace
task templates, with naming constraints to ensure compatibility with Tekton object
limits.

name.description:
The unique name of the Tekton task template. Naming constraints apply based
on the template type to ensure compatibility with Tekton object name length
limits.

type.description:
The type of task template. Use 'onePerSaasFile' for templates that are unique
per SaaS file, or 'onePerNamespace' for templates that are unique per namespace.

path.description:
The file path to the task template definition. This should be a relative path
within the repository where the template is stored.

variables.description:
A mapping of variable names to values for parameterizing the task template.
Variables can be used to customize task behavior for different deployments.

name.description:
One per namespace file Template name. It is limited in size as the tekton
task name is limited to 63 characters.

One per saas file Template name. It is very limited in size as the tekton
object final name will also contain the saas file and the total size is
limited to 63 characters.

allowUnmanagedFeatureToggles.description: Set to true to allow unmanaged/manually created feature toggles

/app-sre/vault-secret-parameter-1.yml.title: Vault Secret Parameter
/app-sre/vault-secret-parameter-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining a parameter sourced from a Vault secret. These parameters
are used to inject sensitive values, such as credentials or tokens, into
OpenShift templates or Helm charts during deployment. Parameter names must
start with a letter and may only contain letters, numbers, and underscores,
to comply with OpenShift template requirements. This enables secure and
automated handling of secrets in deployment pipelines.

name.description:
The name of the parameter to be injected. Must start with a letter and
contain only letters, numbers, and underscores. This restriction ensures
compatibility with OpenShift template parameter naming requirements.

secret.description:
Reference to the Vault secret containing the value for this parameter.
The secret will be retrieved and injected at deployment time.

items.description: The regions where the account is enabled and can be used.

name.description: The name of the security contact.

title.description: The title of the security contact. Default use the name.

phoneNumber.description:
The phone number associated with this alternate contact.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/accounts/latest/reference/API_AlternateContact.html

automationRole.description: Role per integration or use-case to assume in the account

awsAccountManager.description: The AWS account manager IAM role name in the payer account

integrations.description: integrations to disable for the aws account

partition.description: the partition used in ARNs in the account (arn:aws:...)

terraformState.description: key information for a terraform's state location and integration

rosa.description: Rosa related attributes in the aws account.

billingAccount.description: AWS account to be used as the Billing account for ROSA HCP cluster provisioning

sso.description: Enable single sign on for the account. Default is enabled.

alias.description: The alias for the account. This is the name that appears in the AWS SSO page. If not set, the account name will be used.

items.description: AWS quota limits for this account

organizationAccountTags.description: For payer accounts only! Apply these tags to all accounts in the organization. This is useful for tagging all accounts in the organization with the same tags.

externalResources.description: External resources settings for the account.

channel.description: The channel to use for external resource modules.

/aws/account-request-1.yml.title: Account Request
/aws/account-request-1.yml.description:
Schema for requesting the creation of a new AWS account. This schema captures
all required information for AppSRE to automate AWS account creation, including
account name, owner, organization, quota limits, and additional features.
Account requests are processed by integrations to provision accounts, assign
organizational units, set tags, and configure initial quotas. This enables
GitOps-driven, auditable, and self-service AWS account management.
After successful account creation, automation deletes the
`account-request-1.yml` file and adds `account-1.yml` file.

name.description:
Unique name for the AWS account. This will be used as the account alias
and must be between 3 and 63 characters, containing only digits, lowercase
letters, and hyphens (-). The name cannot begin or end with a hyphen.

description.description:
A detailed description of the AWS account, its intended use, or any
relevant context for the request.

accountOwner.description:
Information about the owner of the AWS account. The owner is responsible
for the account and will be the main point of contact.

name.description: The name of the account owner.

email.description: The email address of the account owner.

organization.description:
Reference to the AWS organization where the account will be created.
Includes payer account, organizational unit, and tags.

quotaLimits.description:
A list of initial AWS quota limits to set for this account. Each entry
references a quota limits object, specifying service and quota codes.

resourcesDefaultRegion.description: The default AWS region for resources created in this account.

supportedDeploymentRegions.description: A list of AWS regions where deployments are supported for this account.

uid.description:
The AWS account UID. If specified, this request will take over an existing
account instead of creating a new one. Ensure the current owner and
organization are specified.

additionalFeatures.description:
Enable or disable additional features for this account. Refer to the
account template for all available feature options.

accountFileTargetPath.description:
The target path for the new account file in app-interface. Defaults to
`/aws/<account_name>/account.yml` if not specified.

/aws/asg-defaults-1.yml.title: ASG Defaults
/aws/asg-defaults-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining default configuration values for AWS Auto Scaling Groups (ASGs).
This schema enables teams to specify baseline settings for scaling, instance types,
networking, security, and lifecycle management. These defaults are used to ensure
consistent and reliable ASG deployments across environments.

max_size.description: The maximum number of instances allowed in the Auto Scaling Group.

min_size.description: The minimum number of instances to maintain in the Auto Scaling Group.

iam_role_name.description: The name of the IAM role to associate with instances in the ASG.

instance_types.description: A list of EC2 instance types that can be launched by the ASG.

vpc_zone_identifier.description: A list of subnet IDs for the ASG. Instances will be launched in these subnets.

capacity_rebalance.description:
If true, enables capacity rebalancing to proactively replace instances
at risk of interruption (for Spot Instances).

max_instance_lifetime.description:
The maximum lifetime (in seconds) for instances in the ASG. Instances
exceeding this age will be terminated and replaced.

protect_from_scale_in.description: If true, protects instances from being terminated during scale-in events.

enabled_metrics.description: A list of metrics to enable for the ASG. Metrics are reported to CloudWatch.

instances_distribution.description:
Configuration for distributing instances between On-Demand and Spot capacity.
Controls allocation strategies and pool sizes for cost optimization.

spot_allocation_strategy.description: The strategy for allocating Spot Instances in the ASG.

on_demand_base_capacity.description: The minimum amount of the group's capacity that must be fulfilled by On-Demand Instances.

on_demand_percentage_above_base_capacity.description: The percentage of additional capacity above the base that should be On-Demand.

spot_instance_pools.description: The number of Spot Instance pools to use for diversification.

instance_refresh_preferences.description: Preferences for instance refresh operations, such as rolling updates.

instance_warmup.description: The time (in seconds) to wait after launching a new instance before it is considered healthy.

min_healthy_percentage.description: The minimum percentage of healthy instances required during a refresh.

vpc_security_group_ids.description: A list of security group IDs to associate with the ASG instances.

update_default_version.description: If true, updates the default launch template version for the ASG.

device_name.description: The device name exposed to the instance (e.g., /dev/xvda).

volume_size.description: The size of the EBS volume (in GiB).

volume_type.description: The type of EBS volume to attach.

encrypted.description: If true, the EBS volume will be encrypted.

block_device_mappings.description:
A list of block device mappings for the ASG instances, specifying
device names and EBS volume configurations.

instance_requirements.description:
Requirements for EC2 instance selection, such as vCPU and memory limits,
and excluded instance types.

min.description: The minimum number of vCPUs required.

max.description: The maximum number of vCPUs allowed.

excluded_instance_types.description: A list of EC2 instance types to exclude from selection.

/aws/cleanup-option-1.yml.description: Define cleanup options of AWS objects.

regex.description: Regex expression to filter items by.

age.description: AMI age from which we can consider deletion.

delete_empty_log_group.description: Enable deletion when log group is empty.

apply_immediately.description: Specifies whether any modifications are applied immediately, or during the next maintenance window. Default: false

at_rest_encryption_enabled.description: Specifies whether to enable encryption at rest.

auto_minor_version_upgrade.description: Specifies whether minor engine upgrades are applied automatically to the cache cluster during the maintenance window. Default: true

automatic_failover_enabled.description: Specifies whether a read-only replica is automatically promoted to read/write primary if the existing primary fails. Default: true

availability_zones.description: List of Availability Zones in which cache nodes are created. terraform attribute: preferred_cache_cluster_azs

cluster_mode.description: Enables data partitioning across distinct nodes in a Redis (cluster mode enabled) replication group.

num_node_groups.description: The number of node groups (shards) for this Redis replication group. Terraform attribute: num_node_groups

replicas_per_node_group.description: An optional parameter that specifies the number of replica nodes in each node group (shard). Terraform attribute: replicas_per_node_group

engine.description: The name of the cache engine to be used for the cache clusters in this replication group.

engine_version.description: The version number of the cache engine to be used for the cache clusters in this replication group.

items.description: Specifies the destination and format of Redis SLOWLOG or Redis Engine Log

maintenance_window.description: The weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can occur. Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi

multi_az_enabled.description: Specifies whether to enable Multi-AZ Support for the replication group

node_type.description: Instance class for the cache cluster. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/red-ug/CacheNodes.SupportedTypes.html

notification_topic_arn.description: ARN of an SNS topic to send ElastiCache notifications to.

number_cache_clusters.description: The number of cache clusters (primary and replicas) in this replication group. Terraform attribute: num_cache_clusters

parameter_group_name.description: The name of the parameter group to associate with this replication group. If this argument is omitted, the default cache parameter group for the specified engine is used.

port.description: The port number on which each of the cache nodes accepts connections. Default: 6379

replication_group_description.description: The replication group description. Default: 'elasticache cluster'

security_group_ids.description: List of security group IDs to associate with this replication group.

snapshot_retention_limit.description: The number of days for which ElastiCache retains automatic cache cluster snapshots before deleting them. For zero (0), backups are turned off.

snapshot_window.description: The daily time range (in UTC) during which ElastiCache begins taking a daily snapshot of the node group. Minimum a 60 minute period. Format: hh24:mi-hh24:mi

subnet_group_name.description: The name of the cache subnet group to be used for the replication group.

transit_encryption_enabled.description: Specifies whether to enable encryption in transit.

transit_encryption_mode.description: Specifies whether to use encryption in transit for the replication group.

service_updates_enabled.description: Enable or disable automatic service updates for the ElastiCache cluster. Default: true

service_updates_types.description: A list of the service update types that will be applied automatically for the replication group. Default: ['security-update', 'engine-update']

service_updates_severities.description: A list of the service update severity levels that can be applied for the replication group. Default: ['critical', 'important']

service_updates_cooldown_days.description: The number of days that ElastiCache will wait before applying a service update to the replication group. Default: 14 days for production, 7 days for staging, and 5 days for others.

master_user_secret.description:
Secret containing the user/password authentication data. It must only
contain the "master_user_name" and "master_user_password" keys

admin_user_arn.description:
The ARN for the admin user.
This option is mutually exclusive with admin_user_credentials.

admin_user_credentials.description:
Secret containing the user/password authentication data. It must only
contain the "master_user_name" and "master_user_password" keys.
The admin user password must be at least 8 chars long, contain at least one
uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number, and one special character.
This option is mutually exclusive with admin_user_arn.

/aws/group-1.yml.title: Group
/aws/group-1.yml.description:
Schema for defining AWS groups. Groups represent collections of users
or entities within an AWS account, along with associated policies
and metadata.

account.description:
Reference to the AWS account associated with the group. This links
the group to its parent account.

name.description:
The unique name of the group. This name is used to identify the group
within the AWS account.

description.description: A detailed description of the group, explaining its purpose and scope.

policies.description:
A list of policies associated with the group. Each policy defines
permissions and access controls for the group.

ou.description: AWS organizational unit. Use path to the OU, e.g. /Root/OrgUnit1/Foo/Bar

mandatory.description: is policy mandatory in the account

serviceCode.description: Specifies the service identifier. To find the service code value for an Amazon Web Services service, use the ListServices operation.

quotaCode.description: Specifies the quota identifier. To find the quota code for a specific quota, use the ListServiceQuotas operation, and look for the QuotaCode response in the output for the quota you want.

value.description: Specifies the new, increased value for the quota.

auth.description: Authentication configuration for the proxy. We currently only support auth via secret, hence the required fields.

auth_scheme.description: The type of authentication that the proxy uses for connections from the proxy to the underlying database

client_password_auth_type.description: The type of authentication the proxy uses for connections from clients

description.description: A user-specified description about the authentication used by a proxy to log in as a specific database user

iam_auth.description: Whether to require or allow AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) authentication for connections to the proxy

secret_name.description: Secret name that the proxy uses to authenticate to the RDS DB instance or Aurora DB cluster

username.description: The name of the database user to which the proxy connects

connection_borrow_timeout.description: The number of seconds for a proxy to wait for a connection to become available in the connection pool. Terraform attribute: connection_borrow_timeout

db_instance_identifier.description: DB instance identifier. The identifier of the RDS DB instance target

debug_logging.description: Whether the proxy includes detailed information about SQL statements in its logs. Default: false

engine_family.description: The kinds of databases that the proxy can connect to. This value determines which database network protocol the proxy recognizes when it interprets network traffic to and from the database

iam_role_force_detach_policies.description: Specifies to force detaching any policies the IAM role has before destroying it. Default: true

iam_role_max_session_duration.description: The maximum session duration (in seconds) for the IAM role. Default: 43200

idle_client_timeout.description: The number of seconds that a connection to the proxy can be inactive before the proxy disconnects it. Default: 1800

init_query.description: One or more SQL statements for the proxy to run when opening each new database connection

log_group_retention_in_days.description: Specifies the number of days you want to retain log events in the CloudWatch log group. Default: 30

max_connections_percent.description: The maximum size of the connection pool for each target in a target group. Default: 90

max_idle_connections_percent.description: Controls how actively the proxy closes idle database connections in the connection pool. Default: 50

require_tls.description: A Boolean parameter that specifies whether Transport Layer Security (TLS) encryption is required for connections to the proxy. Default: true

session_pinning_filters.description: Each item in the list represents a class of SQL operations that normally cause all later statements in a session using a proxy to be pinned to the same underlying database connection

vpc_security_group_ids.description: One or more VPC security group IDs to associate with the new proxy

vpc_subnet_ids.description: One or more VPC subnet IDs to associate with the new proxy

/aws/sharing-option-1.yml.description: define sharing options between aws accounts

regex.description: regex expression to filter items by

ref.description: commit SHA, not a branch like main or master

projectPath.description: path in the repo where the terraform files are located

delete.description: set to true to delete the repo

requireFips.description: whether this repo should be validated to ensure it is using FIPS endpoints for AWS

tfVersion.description: Which version of terraform binary to use

forceRerunTimestamp.description: force a rerun of tf-repo using ISO8601 format which can be grabbed with https://www.utctime.net/

variables.description: Vault paths defining where Terraform inputs are read from and where Terraform outputs are written to

switchover_timeout.description:
The amount of time, in seconds, for the switchover to complete.
If the switchover takes longer than the specified duration,
then any changes are rolled back, and no changes are made to the environments.
The default timeout period is 300 seconds (5 minutes).
This is the max allowed downtime, use it to plan maintenance window.

allocated_storage.description:
The amount of storage in gibibytes (GiB) to allocate for the green DB instance.
You can choose to increase or decrease the allocated storage on the green DB instance.
Range from 20GiB to 16TiB (20-16384).

grafana_datasource.description: is rds instance used as a grafana datasource

ingress_cidr_blocks.description: ingress cidr blocks to allow for an alb

max_session_duration.description:
Maximum session duration (in seconds) that you want to set for the specified role.
If you do not specify a value for this setting, the default maximum of one hour is applied.
